arm_group.arm_group_label: NPs & PAs referral discussions with a supervising physician
arm_group.description: required consultations between NPs and PAs and their supervising physicians

arm_group.arm_group_label: NPs and PAs  - no consultations with supervising physisians
arm_group.description: NPs and PAs who are not required to discuss patient referrals

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators have previously demonstrated utilizing a validated tool, that the quality
      of referrals from nurse practitioners (NP) and physician assistants (PA) is less than
      referrals from physicians.  The investigators hypothesize that with local physician input,
      the quality of referrals from nurse practitioners and physician assistants will improve.
      This is a prospective study comparing patient referrals from nurse practitioners and
      physician assistants with and without prior discussion with a local physician.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Program of Physician Supervision to Improve the Quality of Patient Referrals From Nurse Practitioners and Physician Assistants
clinical_study.condition: Care of Complex Patients by Non Physicians.

criteria.textblock: All nurse practitioners and physician assistants in the Mayo Clinic Health System

intervention.arm_group_label: NPs & PAs referral discussions with a supervising physician
intervention.description: Required discussion with physician prior to referral by a nurse practitioner or physician assistant
intervention.intervention_name: Consultations between NPs and PAs and their supervising physicians

intervention.arm_group_label: NPs and PAs  - no consultations with supervising physisians
intervention.intervention_name: versus NPs and PAs who are not required to discuss patient referrals (control group).

clinical_study.official_title: Implementing a Program of Physician Supervision to Improve the Quality of Patient Referrals From Nurse Practitioners and Physician Assistants

primary_outcome.measure: Improved referrals from nurse practitioners and physician assistants to physicians as determined using a previously validated tool

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
